Posts.Content: jci wrote: Hi everyone.  Here's my story - I have had cystic breasts since my 20's, am 45 now.  Just before my last period, I had terrible nipple pain.  After my period started, the pain subsided, but not totally.  Then I noticed a yellow callous on the nipple - I never saw any leakage - bra was always clean. I went to my gyn last thursday and had an ultrasound that revealed a 10mm nodule under my nipple.  The radiologist said that he couldn't remove it because it was too close to the surface, so is sending me to surgeon.  He did say that it was round.  Have my first appt with the surgeon tomorrow afternoon.  I am so scared, I am nauseous and pretty non functional.  All I can think of is my 5 and 9 year old kids and how they need me. Sorry - talking about it makes it better and the more informed I am.... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New & Terrified jci jancie

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2010 02:25PM jci wrote: Thanks ladies.  I had to pick up my images from my gyn this afternoon and drop them off at the surgeons office.  Of course, I rifled through the envelope and copied down what the radiologist report said - "1 cm echo poor nodule directly under nipple which does demonstrate some internal vascularity.  Predominantly well defined, smooth border.  No nodule or cyst elsewhere.  Because of location, surgical biopsy rather than ultrasound biopsy recommended". If I wasn't crazy before, I am now!
Posts.Title: New & Terrified jci jancie
